awd_titl_txt: RIA:  Isomorphism Problems in Structural Complexity Theory
awd_abstract_narration: This project is concerned with isomorphism problems for complete sets           in complexity classes.  For example, one of the most important open             questions in structural complexity theory is whether the NP-complete            sets are all isomorphic under polynomial time computable and polynomial         time invertible bijections.  The study focuses on conditions under              which such isomorphisms do or do not exist for complete problems in             natural complexity classes, such NP and exponential time, and on the            implications of these conditions.  In addition to polynomial time               isomorphism, weaker forms of polynomial time equivalence are also being         investigated for complete problems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
